entry.title: Strangers in the Night
entry.summary:
Author: unnamedmystery

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 31,002Chapters: 12/?Kudos: 134

Summary: When the Daily Planet heard word of a new vigilante in Crime Alley that supposedly had no affiliation with Batman, Perry White thought it to be a nice short story‚Äîa quick in and out. After all, while the people of Metropolis had Superman, everyone knew of Batman, and a vigilante not working with him seemed interesting. At least, that‚Äôs what Perry told his college intern. And her mentor Clark Kent when he raised concerns. No one told her that the vigilante was intimidatingly attractive. Or that Crime Alley was the worse place in Gotham City. Or that her mentor would ask a friend to keep tabs on her. Or that the detective she‚Äôs staying with hates Batman despite working with him frequently. Or that the detectives neighbor was a really cute guy.

entry.title: last night i thought of you (years ago, when bodies grew)
entry.summary:
Author: artemissrx6

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,510Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 9

Summary: Sometimes you wish you never met him. The boy with the stars shining in his eyes, a smile so big it could light up the entirety of Crime Alley, dying so young and taking a piece of you along the way. You probably never would've taken up this hobby, would never start fighting and hurting every single day. If only he hadn't come back when he did, pulled you alongside him and got you scarred and tormented for the rest of your life. It's not fair, a part of you knows that, but he already admitted to using you and pulling your strings to have backup in his excellent plan to take over Gotham; trying to force Bruce to yield to his breakdown-derived ideas. He apologized, but you're not ready. Probably never will be, no matter how much your heart still yearns for him every single time you fall asleep. And no amount of apologies will make up for everything he's done. You may forgive him, but forgetting isn't even in the near vicinity of the table. It used be just you and him out here, but now, there are no strings tying you to this city, aside from vague nostalgia.

entry.title: Red Hood, Green Heart
entry.summary:
Author: Persadol

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 83,727Chapters: 11/?Kudos: 93

Summary: Jason Todd has died before-and he hasn't quite come back whole. Haunted by shadows of his past and the weight of justice in Gotham, he finds comfort only in silence and the static crackle of Alfred's voice in his comms.That is, until the night a portal rips open above him and a very unexpected visitor-blue-skinned, horned, and definitely not from this world-crashes straight into his life. Literally.You're a druid from the forests of the Forgotten Realms, on a peaceful path of healing and harmony‚Ä¶ until a bandit ambush and a wild spell gone wrong land you flat on top of a masked stranger in a dark, alien city.Jason doesn't do magic. You don't do guns. But somehow, between Gotham rooftops and druidic spells, trauma and trust, gunfire and green growth-you might just change each other's worlds.

entry.summary:
Author: SuperCerulean

His best friend is dead, his family thinks he's on the verge of a meltdown, and the one person who might understand is locked up in Arkham and hates his guts. Knowing he's getting to a point where things are going to overwhelm him, he can either let himself react the way he reacts, or he can do something drastic to try and prevent the next Arkham Knight situation. Which one do you think he goes with?
